triples.evidence: This function has a certain frequency structure, and that’s captured in its Fourier transform
When you sum up all these wave components, you reconstruct the original image
the rotated spatial function leads to a rotated frequency spectrum

concepts.term: understanding structure in terms of frequency
Fourier analysis is the bridge between them

triples.evidence: Suppose you have a 2D function - like the white rectangular bar you see on the top-left image.
As you can see in the second row, the rotated spatial function leads to a rotated frequency spectrum.
